After about 30 minutes of messing with the keygen, I finally figured out how to get it to work (not very user friendly)  When the Adobe registration window comes up, load up the keygen and press the "Generate Serial" button.  This should produce two different keys.  (Note: Keep the keygen open and don't regenerate the keys) Now in the activation window, click the Change Serial and enter the top key from the keygen into the serial number in the activation window.  Click the Next button.  The key should be valid and a new window will appear stating this is an upgrade key and you need to enter another valid serial for a previous Adobe version.  Ignore this and press Cancel.  Now go to the activate by phone link.  When you click it, it'll show the serial number you just entered along with an activation code.  Copy that activation code into the blank spot in the keygen and click Activate.  Enter the new response code created by the keygen into the activation window.  Your version should now be registered.  BTW, sorry for the long winded comment.  Just wanted to make sure the method is clear.
